abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column points out that in debate over same-sex marriage, growing number of religious leaders and theologians have been advocating within their own faiths for decades for reforms that would support homosexual unions.
lead_paragraph: For over a half-century, scholars in a range of faiths have been assembling scriptural arguments in favor of gay rights and ultimately marriage equality.

headline.main: Push Within Religions for Gay Marriage Gets Little Attention
